data.message: The beach I went to had loads of plastic waste...I suppose Coke don't mind as they're responsible for a lot of it. 100 billion throwaway plastic bottles a year - wow coca cola you're doing a really good job of filling the oceans!

replies.message: Coca Cola aren't filling the oceans. Ignorant people who can't be bothered disposing of their waste properly are responsible.

Actually they make the bottles at a rate of 100 billion a year - they're not biodegradable and they can't be disposed of. Even if you put them in your recycling they can't be disposed of. Think about the amount of them! . If cc were to recycle or reuse the bottles or make them from biodegradable plastic - they make enough profit for heaven's sake - they wouldn't be there would they. Coca cola are totally responsible for creating the bottles and them ending up in the ocean. Totally irresponsible company

Sue Bennett you do raise an interesting ethical point: does the responsibility for plastic disposal lie with Coca-Cola, or exclusively with its consumers? Really the answer relates to whether you believe in the idea of obligation. If you as a passive individual happen upon a circumstance which only you can make better (e.g. you see a drowning child, who you can save) are you obliged to help even though you didn't cause the situation? Most including myself would say yes. In the same manner, Coca-Cola aren't causing people to dump plastic in the ocean, but they easily have the power to make a bottle that biodegrades or to explore other bottle options such as refillable flasks (like Costa). But they don't do that, because it costs more.
